translator.preprocessor
Class ExpressionEvaluator

java.lang.Object
  translator.preprocessor.ExpressionEvaluator
All Implemented Interfaces:
PreprocessorGlobals
public class ExpressionEvaluator
extends Object
implements PreprocessorGlobals

ExpressionEvaluator evaluates Essence' expressions. Expressions are either atoms (boolean, integer or (matrix-)identifiers) or expressions composed by unary and binary operators or quantifications. For further information, check the documentation of expressions in the conjure package.
Only expressions in Essence' are evaluated - for instance, sets and set-operators are illegal and exceptions are thrown accordingly.

Observations:

  1. An expression can be evaluated to an atomic expression (a number or a boolean) if it does not contain a decision variable.
  2. If an expression contains a decision variable, then it contains a relational operator of the following set : { =, !=, <, >, <=, >=}
  3. If the expression contains a relational operator, then there is some further evaluation that can be done.
  4. all feasible expressions not containing a relational operator can be evaluated to an atomic expression.
This evaluator does NOT simplify expressions by doing arithmetic on the whole expression, such as transforming "x + 3 = 4" into "x = 1", but only on one side of the relational operator.

Method Detail

evaluateExpression

public AtomicExpression evaluateExpression(Expression e)
                                    throws PreprocessorException
Evaluates Expression e to an AtomicExpression. This method should only be evoked, if the resulting expression explicitly has to be atomic - meaning that the Expression e must not contain any decision variable. It does not check, if e is an illegal atomic expression.

Parameters:
e - an Expression containing no decision variables
Returns:
an AtomicExpression resulting from evaluating e
Throws:
PreprocessorException - is thrown when the Expression cannot be evaluated to an AtomicExpression

evalExpression

public Expression evalExpression(Expression e)
                          throws PreprocessorException
Evaluates Expression e to an Expression, that only consists of decision variables combined with integers/booleans that cannot be further evaluated (without applying artihmetic on the whole expression).

Parameters:
e - an Expression to be evaluated
Returns:
the evaluated Expression e
Throws:
PreprocessorException

                                    throws PreprocessorException

Returns:
the evaluated functional Expression e
Throws:
PreprocessorException

evalExpressionInDomain

public Domain evalExpressionInDomain(Domain d)
                              throws PreprocessorException
Evaluates all expression in Domain d to integers.

Parameters:
d - the Domain whose expressions will be evaluated
Returns:
Domain d whose expressions are evaluated to integers

PreprocessorException

isFeasibleExpression

public boolean isFeasibleExpression(Expression e)
                             throws PreprocessorException
Determine if the expression (or a relational subexpression) is false when it is completely evaluated.
E.g. 3 < 2 /\ x[2] = 4
is evaluated to false, because 3 < 2 is false. But x[2] = 4 would be evaluated to true, since it can not be proven wrong. But since it is disjuncted with 3 < 2, the whole expression is evaluated to false.

Parameters:
e - the Expression that is checked for being true or false if completly evaluated
Returns:
true if the Expression e cannot be proven to be false if completly evaluated
Throws:
PreprocessorException

removeAtomicSubExpressions

public Expression removeAtomicSubExpressions(Expression e)
                                      throws PreprocessorException
Removes the atomic subexpression "true" in conjunctions. Consider for instance that the expression "a \/ true" can be evaluated to "a".

Parameters:
e - the Expression whose atomic subexpressions are removed
Returns:
Expression e without subexpressions "true"
Throws:
PreprocessorException

                                   Expression e)

e - the Expression to be searched in
